title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Urban Vehicle Positioning Control Design for [Self-Directed] Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of control systems, programming (e.g., Python), linear algebra, and basic concepts of probability theory
context.additional_context: Utilization of practical model simulations in smartphone-centric environments, analyzing learning cases to resolve GPS signal interference issues in real urban settings.

learning_goals: Design a vehicle positioning control system in urban environments using reinforcement learning-based control algorithms
Analyze positioning errors caused by multipath effects and incorporate them into control systems
Evaluate control performance using smartphone-based simulation tools in limited technical environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
